page.title: 06BUILDING DEVELOPMENT
page.content:
During the middle part of the 19th century the{Duke of Bedford}owned Souldrop and much of the surrounding area. In order to improve life for the farm workers he built two rows of small cottages in Souldrop high street in 1854.
The larger farm{cottages}dated 1865, were also built by the Duke and were some of the first 3-bedroomed cottages with largish gardens to be provided for farm workers.
In 1924,{Sir Albert Bowen}left Â£100 to many of the tenants and this was more than enough for them to buy their own properties when the village was split up into lots and sold in 1925.
